Find scaling factor from object of known length

Source: R/radialMeasurements.R
findScalingFactor.Rd

This computes a scaling factor (i.e., a multiplier that is used to convert image lengths to actual lengths) from user selected endpoints of an object of known length on the image given in fname and the actual known length given in knownLength.

findScalingFactor(fname = file.choose(), knownLength, sepWindow, windowSize,
  col.scaleBar, lwd.scaleBar)

Arguments

fname

A string that indicates the image (must be PNG, JPG, or BMP) to be loaded and plotted. By default the user will be provided a dialog box from which to choose the file. Alternatively the user can supply the name of the file (will look for this file in the current working directory unless a fully pathed name is given).
knownLength

See details in RFBCoptions.
sepWindow

See details in RFBCoptions.
windowSize

See details in RFBCoptions.
col.scaleBar

See details in RFBCoptions.
lwd.scaleBar

See details in RFBCoptions.

Value

A single numeric that is the scaling factor (a multiplier that is used to convert image lengths to actual lengths).

Details

None yet.

Examples

## None yet
